title: Store bug?
body: I tried clicking on the store but it says Error Code: 0 is anyone having this issue as well? I've already reported the bug, and my hubs is having the same issue as well. Hoping riot can fix it soon

replies.body: The client's not perfect, thanks for submitting the bug report! Were you able to get it working after rebooting the client?
If only you were that fast in the Gameplay section
I find sometimes, people want to vent and not discuss in the gameplay section :). Sometimes its better to let it out. We are always paying attention though.

sorry for cutting in like this, but while i agree a lot of the gameplay section is used to vent, i think it would be good if a rioter could atleast acknowledge the things being sad because it's a lot more frustrating when it seems like riot isnt even listening to the complains being made to the game. for example when meddler was talking about the snowballing effect in league and not knowing the cause while a lot of players already vented about their frustration that a lot of snowball power comes from the runes, making it almost seem like riot themselve is just not reallt listening to what the players have to say.

these are just my thoughts on the matter though, im sure the game will come through but i wish riot showed more attention to the gameplay section to make sure players can be rest assured that their concerns with the game are heard.

For sure, totally agree community feels could use a bit more validation of at least "you are correct to feel this way". FWIW I believe what Meddler was talking about in his post of not knowing the cause is a validation of player frustrations (aka, players **suspect** the snowball is coming from runes, but can we confirm that?). Thats why insightful feedback is super useful because it gives us a lead that we can hunt down and hopefully directs us to the root problem. Sometimes it is exactly what players say is the cause, and other times it is something completely different, but we have to do that discovery otherwise we risk doing more harm than good. However, completely agree it can be hard sometimes because the language potentially feels ignorant of community sentiment. 

Also, from a communication POV it can just be hard to talk on a public forum. There are times (and I speak from personal experience) where we share those "totally hear you and you're right to feel that way" posts, and we get smacked down with a flood of hate speech and negative comments. If you can imagine, it makes it tough to come back and do it all over again. That being said I personally want to try, hence why I'm here :)

You are correct.
 that was just  a joke on my part
Satire & irony are hard to detect via text x).
Just tried that now, its good now. Thanks! :)
